caption: SENDING A REMINDER Struggling in Ukraine’s east, Russia struck Kyiv on Sunday for the first time in more than a month. Page A9.
image_1.context: What followed happens more often in Suffolk County than any other county in the state: A judge issued a “red $\mathrm{{flag^{\prime\prime}}}$ order that In late March, a 16-year-old in Suffolk County, $\mathrm{N.Y.,60}$ miles east of New York City, told fellow students that he wanted to shoot their heads off, according to court records. He told the police that he wanted to hurt himself with a shotgun at his house. The boy made his threat aboard a school bus. This article is by Andy Newman, Benjamin Weiser and Ashley Southall. Taking Guns From Those in Crisis: A County’s ‘Red Flag’ Lessons NEW YORK, MONDAY, JUNE 6, 2022
image_1.description: The image depicts a dense urban landscape dominated by high-rise apartment buildings. The buildings are primarily white and beige, with some structures featuring orange accents. The architecture is uniform, characterized by repetitive patterns of windows and balconies. The scene is set against a cloudy sky, with dark clouds looming in the background, suggesting an overcast day. The overall atmosphere conveys a sense of density and urban sprawl, with no visible natural elements or open spaces. The buildings appear to be residential, given their design and the presence of numerous windows and balconies. There are no people, vehicles, or other objects visible in the image, focusing solely on the architectural elements and the sky.

caption: Fertilizing a wheat field near Kharkiv, Ukraine, in April.
image_2.context: Russia and Ukraine normally supply about 40 percent of wheat needs in Africa, where prices for the grain have risen 23 percent in the On top of that, the continent is suffering badly. On Friday, the head of the African Union, President Macky Sall of Senegal, met in Russia with President Vladimir V. Putin, in an ernment accusations that Russia has stolen up to 500,000 tons of Ukrainian wheat, worth \$100 million, since Russia’s invasion in February. Much of it has been trucked to ports in Russia-controlled Crimea, then transferred to ships, including some under Western sanctions, Ukrainian officials say. other, refusing cheap food at a time when wheat prices are soaring and hundreds of thousands of people are starving. The alarm sounded by Wash  Critics said the trip, during which Mr. Sall referred to his “dear friend Vladimir,” played straight into Mr. Putin’s hands by offering him yet another tool to leverage divisions in the international response to his brutal assault on Ukraine. But many African nations are already ambivalent about the punishing Western campaign of sanctions against Russia for reasons that include their dependence on Russian arms sales, lingering Cold War-era sympathies and perceptions of Western double standards.
image_2.description: The image depicts a scene of agricultural activity in a wheat field near Kharkiv, Ukraine, captured in April. A blue tractor is prominently positioned in the center of the frame, actively engaged in fertilizing the field. The tractor is moving across the lush green expanse of the wheat field, leaving behind a trail of dust and fertilizer. The field itself is expansive, with rows of young wheat plants visible, indicating early growth stages. In the background, there is a line of trees and shrubs separating the field from what appears to be a forested area. The sky above is clear, suggesting a sunny day, which is typical for springtime in this region. The overall atmosphere conveys a sense of routine agricultural work amidst a backdrop of natural beauty and tranquility. The context provided indicates that this image was taken during a period of significant global concern regarding wheat supply, particularly affecting African nations due to the ongoing conflict between Russia and Ukraine.

image_3.context: Progressive Prosecutor Faces a Recall SAN FRANCISCO — As the former chair of the San Francisco Democratic Party, Mary Jung has a long list of liberal bona fides, including her early days in politics volunteering in Ohio for the presidential campaign of George McGovern and her service on the board of the local Planned Parenthood branch. “In Cleveland, I was considered a communist,” she By TIM ARANGO and THOMAS FULLER Debate on Crime Splits San Francisco Democrats Revelers in Windsor toasted Queen Elizabeth II’s 70-year reign at the Big Jubilee Lunch. Page A9. A Jubilee, and a Cup of Tea deaths and 22 injuries, many of them children. Although shootings across the country traditionally begin to rise with the approach of summer, the scenes of carnage over the weekend after massacres in Buffalo, Uvalde, Texas, and Tulsa, Okla., left cities shaken though, tellingly, not shocked. “People are afraid to let their kids out of the house,” Mayor Jim Kenney of Philadelphia said in an interview. But he added that there was little he could say to reassure frightened or grieving residents. “Words are hard,” Mr. Kenney said. “Words these days have become somewhat meaningless.” As of Sunday evening, the po
image_3.description: The image depicts a lively outdoor event, likely a celebration or picnic, with a large crowd of people gathered on a grassy field. The main focus is on two individuals seated at a small table in the foreground. The woman is wearing a white jacket and a colorful wig adorned with Union Jack flags, while the man is dressed in a dark jacket and hat. They are surrounded by various items including a blue cooler bag, a plate with food, and several Union Jack flags. The background shows numerous other attendees seated on folding chairs, many of whom are also decorated with Union Jack flags. The atmosphere appears festive and communal, with people enjoying food and drinks, and the overall scene suggests a patriotic celebration, possibly related to a royal event given the Union Jack flags and the mention of Queen Elizabeth II's jubilee in the context provided.

image_6.description: The image depicts a majestic waterfall cascading over a rugged cliff into a turbulent pool below. The waterfall is wide and powerful, with water rushing down in multiple streams, creating a misty spray at the base. The surrounding landscape is characterized by a vast, open plain that stretches out to distant mountains. These mountains have a mix of rocky terrain and patches of snow, indicating a cold climate. The sky above is mostly clear with a few wispy clouds, suggesting a bright and sunny day. The overall scene conveys a sense of natural grandeur and tranquility, with the waterfall being the central focus of the image.
